Grain. Mill near Principio.

Ambrose Ewing, Miller, and Dealer in Wheat, Flour,
Feed and Grain of all kinds. Mill near Colora,

Miscellaneous.

Wm, Grason, Proprietor of the “Maryland House” and
Livery Stable. Best accommodations in the county,

Mrs. Helen L. Terry, Dress-maker. Making done to or-
der. Those having work in her line will find it to
their interest to patronize her.

W. W. Carter, Agent P, & B. C. R. R. Co.

Addison & Steele, Manufacturers of Rims, Shafts,
Tongues, Bows, Sleigh Runners, etc, Locust Mills,
near Rising Sun.

Wiltiam Way, Fire Insurance Agent,

Street Brown, Dealer in Hay, Straw, Clover Seed, Bail-

ing Wire, etc. Colora.

Thomas Waring & Bro.,, Manufacturers of Waring’s
Pure Ground Bone, Waring’s Acidulated Phos-
phate, and Waring’s Ammoniated Super-phosphate.

‘W. A. Tosh, Tax Collector of District No, 6.

Wm. H. Harrison, Stone Mason, Those having work
in his line, will find it to their interest to consult
him.

Charles Wells & Co., Paper Manufacturers. Near Ris-
ing Sun. Paper Store in Philadelphia.

George Balderston, Nurseryman and Florist, Dealer in
Shade and Ornam Trees, Green-house Plants,
Shrubbery, etc,
